bill.title: Abandoned Vehicles; Repossession; Disposal
bill.description: Extends for registered owners with an out-of-state address, the number of days during which the legal and registered owner of an abandoned vehicle may repossess the vehicle before it may be subject to disposal. (HB1241 CD1)

history.action: (H) Pending introduction.
(H) Introduced and Pass First Reading.
(H) Referred to TRN, JUD, referral sheet 2
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by TRN on Monday, 02-14-11 9:00AM in House conference room 309.

(H) The committees on TRN recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Souki, Ichiyama, Cullen, M. Lee, Luke, Saiki, Takumi, Yamashita, Fontaine, Johanson; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Aquino.
(H) Reported from TRN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 427) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.
(H) Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with none voting no (0) and Carroll, Herkes, McKelvey excused (3).
(H) Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Thursday, 03-03-11 2:30PM in House conference room 329.

(H) The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Keith-Agaran, Rhoads, Brower, Herkes, Ito, Luke, Souki, Tsuji, Fontaine, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 6 Excused: Representative(s) Cabanilla, Carroll, McKelvey, Morita, B. Oshiro, Marumoto.
(H) Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 814) as amended in HD 2, recommending passage on Third Reading.
(H) Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday, 03-08-11.
(H) Passed Third Reading as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and none excused (0). Transmitted to Senate.
(S) Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 291).
(S) Passed First Reading.
(S) Referred to TIA/CPN, JDL.
(S) The committee(s) on TIA/CPN has scheduled a public hearing on 03-21-11 1:15PM in conference room 224.

(S) The committee(s) on TIA recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in TIA were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) English, Espero, Kahele, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 3 Excused: Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Gabbard, Kouchi.
(S) The committee(s) on CPN deferred the measure until 03-22-11 9:30AM in conference room 229.

(S) The committee(s) on CPN recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPN were as follows: 7 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Taniguchi, Galuteria, Green, Nishihara, Solomon, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
(S) Reported from TIA/CPN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 854) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to JDL.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to JDL.
(S) The committee(s) on JDL will hold a public decision making on 04-06-11 9:00AM in conference room 016.
(S) The committee on JDL has rescheduled its decision making to 04-08-11 9:45AM in conference room 016.

(S) The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Hee, Shimabukuro, Ihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Gabbard, Slom.
(S) Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1221) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
(S) 48 Hrs. Notice 04-12-11.
(S) Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
(H) Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 566) in amended form (SD 2).
(H) House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
(S) Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 573).
(H) Re-referred to TRN, CPC, JUD, referral sheet 58
(H) House conferees appointed: Souki, Herkes, Rhoads Co-Chairs; Luke, Johanson.

(S) Senate Conferees appointed: English, Chair; Baker, Hee, Co-Chair(s); Slom.

(H) Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Thursday, 04-21-11 1:00PM in conference room 225.

(H) The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 4 Ayes: Representative(s) Souki, Herkes, Rhoads, Johanson; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Luke.

(S) The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) English, Baker, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Hee.
(H) Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 52) as amended in (CD 1).
(H) Forty-eight (48) hours notice Friday, 04-29-11.
(S) Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 52).
(S) 48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 04-29-11.
(S) Deferred until 05-03-11.
(H) Deferred one day 05-03-11.
(S) Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). 24 Aye(s); Aye(s) with reservations: none . 0 No(es): none. 1 Excused: Hee.
(H) Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with none voting no (0) and Carroll, Pine excused (2).
(H) Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 694).
(S) Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 702).
(H) Transmitted to Governor.
